text.text: Coleco Adam Home computer Second 1983 Casset, Floppy disk Analog stick, keyboard

text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Adam is an extension module for Colecovision, but was also sold as such. It offered a keyboard, cassette player, printer, expansion slots, 5¼″ floppy disk drive, and 300 baud modem. Still equipped with a 3.58 Mhz processor, 1 kb of RAM, 3 tone generators, 1 noise generator and displaying a resolution of 256x192 pixels and 32 sprites in 16 colors. But it was a bitter commercial failure because of too high a price, its availability only in toy stores and the return under warranty of 60% of the models sold.
